website_summaries.verdict: A high-quality, 2-speed, 200 watt immersion blender that comes with 3 interchangeable stainless steel blades.
pros: This handheld blender is submersible up to 11.4 inches and has a chrome-coated brass shaft that is heat resistant
The powerful motor maintains precise speeds even while operating under heavier loads and the ergonomic handle helps to ensure maximum comfort while blending
cons: The cleanup can be more time consuming than you may be expecting

customer_reviews.title: Fancy mixer for ambitious chefs
customer_reviews.text: I recently received the Bamix Pro-2 G200 mixer, so I'm just getting used to it. It is quite powerful, but at the same time it's also more complicated to clean than my old cheap mixer, because it has detachable parts. If you only need to mix a pint or so of liquid, then you should settle for a cheap mixer from Sears. If you want to mix big pots of soup every day, then Bamix is probably worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Jerzy Pawlowski

customer_reviews.title: I hate cleaning a regular jar blender
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long to get this? I hate cleaning a regular jar blender, and hate the way the air pocket at the bottom requires repeated stopping and stirring. Making smoothies using this together with the Bamix Immersion Blender Beaker is a snap, and so easy to clean up. The one downside I've found is how hard it is to get the blender blades off. I use a thick dishtowel because as hard as one has to pull on those tiny blades, it's a recipe for slicing your finders or hand.
customer_reviews.author: Olga L. Kramar

customer_reviews.title: I hate changing blades
customer_reviews.text: I cant recommend this product because it is nearly impossible to remove the blade. Instructions are to protect your hand with a dish towel and them pull firmly. These is no catch or release to remove the blade, you just have to pull with all your syrength and try not to get a hernia. It is nearly impossible. Don't buy this, I regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sonic mom

customer_reviews.title: Quality product from a well established business
customer_reviews.text: I love this handheld blender. Got one 28 years ago. Still have the book from old blender, it had some great recipes. I would buy another one someday. Best money spent & so easy to use. I was planning on buying straight from company. There website is very informative & shows other products.
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen Falkenberg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cant say enough good things about bamix brand immersion blenders. Super powerful and versatile, they deliver the chefs touch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Love this blender. I have installed it close to the sink so it’s easy to wash off after use. This is easy to use and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: ATZ

customer_reviews.title: I have one that is 20 to 25 years old and running great. I bought this one as a gift for ...
customer_reviews.text: Built to last! I have one that is 20 to 25 years old and running great. I bought this one as a gift for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Carol J Grant

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite tools in the kitchen. I use it everyday. I love the homemade mayonnaise ready in seconds with healthy ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Isabel Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Sheet, smooth power.
customer_reviews.text: My loving wife has killed more stick blenders than I can count. She has finally met her match.
customer_reviews.author: Lepe

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: My first immersion blender! And I love it! Great for soups and smoothies.
customer_reviews.author: Sue McDavid

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and powerful. No plastic parts to wear out is the most important feature to me.
customer_reviews.author: Tobie Matava

customer_reviews.title: Great but one part missing.
customer_reviews.text: I received this and it's a very nice mixer. It was missing the S Blade (slicing) attachment, however. Is there any way that you could ship this to me?
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The goods were delivered soon and the quality was good
customer_reviews.author: taoasis

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous quality and usability
customer_reviews.text: Delivered as expected. Appears to have simple high quality components that are easy to clean and assemble. Works exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: claire watt

customer_reviews.title: New Reincarnation of an Old Favorite
customer_reviews.text: The Bamix G200 is one of many series of high quality immersion blenders. This one is replacing my wife's single-speed version of some 22 years. The old one now occasionally squeals. The G200 has a longer shaft, but the stand was replaced with a wall-mounted holder, so you can't just place the stand on the counter top. The new unit has two speeds, which is better than the old one, but the former on-off rocker switch was replaced with two silicone-covered momentary switches. As a safety feature, you now have to continuously hold down one of the switches during use. This may add safety, but is a royal pain in the finger when you are mixing something for 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: What power and flexibility!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first stick/emersion blender my wife and I purchased, so I cannot compare it to any other brand or model. I purchased this because it got very good reviews, is well constructed, and is basic. In other words, it has the features we need and it's comfortable to use. We purchased the blender because we wanted to have the ability to make smoothy drinks, etc. without having to drag out the big machines. For the few things we have done it has worked very well. However, you really do need a tall cup/container because you will have splatter. :)
customer_reviews.author: Scott_H

customer_reviews.title: Very Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I have nothing to compare it to, but it's so darn heavy. I can barely hold it up with one hand while holding a container with the other. Maybe they are all like this. I will say it does the job. I made cream of tomato soup and it worked perfectly. I just had to stop and start frequently, because of the weight.
customer_reviews.author: rte

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic emulsifier
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I did not leave five stars is because the one does not come off for easy cleanup or dishwasher friendly. I like the idea of 17,000 RPMs as I make Face Cream and it is easy to emulsify at this rate of speed. I found that this mixer doesn’t get clogged up as the other ones because there is no hidden hood so your product cannot hide.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: The new standard.
customer_reviews.text: The 20 year old model I bought at William's Sonoma, just died & this beauty is its replacement. I mainly use the Bamix to make a super foods tonic tea, so here's my advice for liquids... rest the tip on the bottom, start low, crank it up & once the vortex gets going, tilt the Bamix. I can't to see how it purees a large pot of butternut squash soup.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE, the attachments DO NOT STAY ON
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make my homemade soaps and potions but EVERY TIME I use it the blade falls in the HOT SOAP or whatever I am making. Buyer beware unless you like dipping into hot lava or whatever your making to get the attachment out. I wish I would have tried it before the time expired to send it back now I am stuck with a very expensive Immersion Blender I CAN NOT USE.
customer_reviews.author: Shereed

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen addition in a long time
customer_reviews.text: I have never had an immersion blender that is so effective. It delivered fully emulsified dressings and marinades in moments and you can see the design working to pull the ingredients in versus having to constantly move the blender around to get everything mixed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, quiet, quality
customer_reviews.text: Been using this hand blender primarily making mayo of late. Works terrifically. Decent heft without being unduly heavy for extended use. Simple to clean, good attachments. Very comfortable to use. With about thirty minutes total run time on it since I purchased it, I expect the good performance to continue.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy45

customer_reviews.title: This is a solid product, esp. good for hot liquids.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for bulletproof coffee. I has a special blade for liquids. Hot liquids. No plastic in your drink. No worries about you blender falling apart due to sudden high temperatures. Lots of power for every use. Good pulsing action at both speeds. easy to handle. Solid and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap, but great!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a power. Mixing soup in a huge pan is no problem, as the mixer is high (you can put it about 11 inch in the liquid) and powerful enough. But you can also whip small quantities (i.e. 4 cups of cream in a small container) or whip skimmed milk (I first couldn't believe this). You can detach the knives/blades for cleaning, so it's really easy. It's not cheap, but it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Karin R.

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, have no rating as of yet
customer_reviews.text: Have not had an opportunity to use it yet. However, the manual sent does not have any mention of what or how the extra hardware is attached and/or used. There is no mention of what should be used for various concoctions.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline B

customer_reviews.title: think Bamix is the best and very versatile
customer_reviews.text: it is my second Bamix as back up if the first one will die . Very happy with Bamix. Tools are excelent. Cons: gets hot if you use it continiously for more than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. The company we bought it from is ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The company we bought it from is easy to work with. Highly recommend both!
customer_reviews.author: Susie Carter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and performance
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and performance. No more scooping sauses and soups into the food processor or blender. Powerful and efficient. One of my most used kitchen devices!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel L. Abbate

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing kitchen tool! It makes whipped "cream" out of skim milk!
customer_reviews.author: JoLynette Hershey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect design and loads of power
customer_reviews.text: Blows away any other Immersion Blender that I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: NO for CP soap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make soap and this is not all stainless steel. The metal actually leaked into my pot and you could see a line from the swirling I was doing. A grayish blackis swirl, and the the bottom part that you attach the attachments is discolored like aluminum can get. I wanted a stronger commercial duty mixer to speed up my soap mixing. IT has good power but cant have metal leaching into my final product
customer_reviews.author: ENYA

customer_reviews.title: extremely annoying! not sure why I bought this a blender ...
customer_reviews.text: The tips fall off constantly in your beverage, extremely annoying ! not sure why I bought this a blender is better!
customer_reviews.author: Tom D

customer_reviews.title: Does a wonderful job!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Extremely sturdy! Wish the stick would separate from mechanism for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Ducky

product_meta.title: Bamix Pro-2 G200 Professional Series NSF Rated 200 Watt 2 Speed 3 Blade Immersion Hand Blender with Wall Bracket
product_meta.description: This Professional Series Bamix model is handbuilt in Switzerland to last. Each unit is tested many times during production to ensure precise performance. With 2 speeds and 3 stainless steel blades that are easy to change, this hand blender is versatile enough to do countless kitchen tasks. The aerating blade is set at a slight angle for optimum performance to whip or beat liquids, even turning skim milk into a whipped topping. The blending blade mixes, purees and emulsifies thick or creamy mixtures so you can make homemade mayonnaise in seconds. The chopping blade dices raw and cooked fruits and vegetables; makes fruit ice creams, sorbets and smoothies; crushes ice and purees soups and sauces right in the pan on the stove. Optional grinder, powder disk and food processor attachments are available. The precision balanced AC motor reduces vibration to ensure quiet operation and give optimum power at all times. This also makes the 200 watt Bamix extremely energy efficient with unsurpassed power while using less energy. This model is NSF commercial certified. The body housing made of PA6 safety rated nylon is odor resistant, grease repellent and is sealed keeping the motor free from exposure to moisture so the 7.4 inch shaft can be totally immersed even in boiling liquids. The shaft is made of chromated brass which makes it strong, durable and heat resistant. The open mixing head design creates rotating currents to draw food in and down to the blades for more thorough processing. This lets you mix faster and more efficiently. You can use the bamix in pans, pots, high containers, tall glasses and beakers. Easy to clean up by rinsing under running water.
feature_bullets: Hand built in Switzerland with 3 stainless steel interchangeable blades: Aerating blade, Blending blade, and Chopping blade with NSF rating to handle professional cooking projects
Powerful 200 watt AC motor keeps constant, precise speed under heavy loads. It is energy efficient supplying more power with less watts. Balanced to reduce vibration and ensure quiet operation
2 speeds: Low - 17,000 rpms and High - 14,000 RPM with push button control for continuous or pulse action with an ergonomic handle for comfort
7.4 inch shaft is Chrome coated brass. Body is PA6 safety rated nylon and fully sealed. Submersible length is 11.4 inches. Both are high heat resistant to safely use in boiling liquids or hot pots
Open head design creates a perfect vortex to draw food into the blades for faster and more efficient mixing. All parts are easy to clean under running water
